author: @wdam
title: Rehabilitated sea turtles get released
text:
Rehabilitated sea turtles get released
BILOXI, Miss. (WDAM) - The Mississippi Aquarium released 19 Kemp Ridley sea turtles.
Kemp Ridley turtles are physically small but are a largely endangered species, so it was important for the aquarium to get them back in a space where they can thrive.
The public gathered to watch the sea turtles take their first step in an open body of water at the beach across from Edgewater Mall.
The turtles got released in fashion with a Taylor Swift-themed party.
The turtles were given friendship bracelets with their initials, and all the turtles are named after T-Swift songs.
Some people who came to see the turtles get released were sponsors, which means they donated and supported the rehabilitation of the turtles.
One couple, the Andertons, sponsored a sea turtle named ‘Clean.’
“It was really fun, it was something new, something different and something exciting to do on my 71st birthday,” said Martin Anderton, one of Clean’s sponsors.
Both Andertons said they were ecstatic to be a part of a little turtle’s life.
“Watching him put Clean in the water, I had chill bumps, and I teared up,” said Tricia Anderton, one of Clean’s sponsors.
Wednesday’s event was the aquarium’s first creature release of the year.
